text: @purrsistent @jessejanderson @HorriblyJane Saaaame! I use a bujo and it's great! It does help, but it's not a cure for ADHD! Remembering my to do list is not the only struggle i face. So easy to hyperfocus on getting the planner juuuuust right

@purplepanda1310 @grumpyshrubbery Valid! I have to use disposable dinnerware/utensils. Aluminum tins for leftovers. Because doing dishes is just not a battle I'm willing to fight when i have bigger fish to fry. I don't like that it's not eco friendly but it is what is.

@mistahindz 9-12. I don't get enough quality sleep so i have to make up for it with longer hours. I also can't transition into and out of sleep easily so i have to devote 12- 14 hours a day to sleep. I don't have much time for anything other than work but it does make a difference in my ADHD

@luntmeister @grumpyshrubbery Same! I feel like it dries out my mouth. It has to do with saliva i think, like a flavored drink stimulates saliva production and so i feel more hydrated where plain water does not have the same mouth-watering effect

@purplepanda1310 @grumpyshrubbery I found some reusable plastic bottles that are the right size for these packets. Came in a 5pk. The multiples ensure i always have at least one ready for use. 10/10 recommend the jolly rancher flavor packets

When i think of BJ Jupiter i think of locust plagues and paycuts/layoffs so companies can have the illusion of more profit

@HermeticArts333 I was told this in an ADHD thing. It's a way for my brain to get the stimulation it needs. I imagine crashing into medians at high speeds and thinking about how the car might crumple or flip.

@tayloraelor @RachelsADHD @dreamsofskies 100% shaved my head bald because of this. It's cold AF in the winter but i feel so much cleaner and put together. Bonus: fresh stubble us stimming paradise to pet

@KrCampbell99 @twodotsknowwhy @McGirlGal @Ana__George @dreamsofskies I see your logic but the way ADHD treats extended deadlines means we are MORE likely to procrastinate on that thing because now there is no urgency to get the thing done. More space and time for distractions to take us off course and for us to forget laundry entirely.

@19syllables @GoddessOCosplay @That1teddygirl That's the point we don't let those connections fade because they have no value, they are incredibly valuable to us, they fade because we aren't naturally equipped to maintain them in the way NT people expect/need.

@SittingWithADHD Been able to stick to this bedtime routine for 2 months now, I'm so proud and shocked! It also has some flexibility, like i don't always shower or read, the import part is i switch from tasks/computer to snuggle cozy time in bed

@SittingWithADHD Even before when "bedtime" meant shower etc and get into bed i resisted it. I think because i wasn't ready to sleep. But saying it's transition time means if I'm not tired that's ok, I'm just going to go into wind down mode and do things not on electronics and keep the lights low

@SittingWithADHD Setting a "bedtime" doesn't work for me, i compromise on it constantly. But a transition time works great. At 6:30 i start to transition to bed by showering etc and then get into bed. I don't have to sleep yet but I'm not allowed to do anything that excites my hyperfocus

@tommcarthur777 @saul_mondriaan Was gonna say Rabbit/Hare. I think this comes from Chinese mythology of the Rabbit in the moon that creates an elixir of immortality. But don't trust my memory

@HowtoADHD Dopamine isn't a "feel good" hormone so much as it is a hormone of motivation and willpower. And so my lack of perceived motivation/willpower isn't a moral failing or lack of discipline, but a lack of chemicals necessary for me to take action.

I have avoided TikTok because i hear such bad things it. But tbh i see reposts of them in my Pinterest feed around mental health and have gotten some good tips. And my ADHD likes the format. Overall is it worth wading through the garbage??

@TweetsMagick @RyanJamesLoyd I didn't mean you have to accept hexing to be part of the community. I'm saying why it matters if you are being hexed. It's the same for any strangers opinion of you. It shouldn't matter, logically, but for most there is that emotional moment of pain that comes with rejection.
@thatpunkwitch The Loki being the "bad guy" is very much a Christian retelling of Nordic myths hundreds of years after people were actively practicing.

@TweetsMagick @RyanJamesLoyd As to why someone else's intent would matter: you are human and that means being socially driven to an extent. If the tribe turns on you then you are as good as dead. It's a primal survival thing. And unpicking that belief might protect you from a hex but what other consequences?

@TweetsMagick @RyanJamesLoyd Conscious belief is pretty easy to manipulate, but subconscious? Not so much. We all have subconscious myths we tell ourselves that defy logic/usefulness. So we can consciously say we don't believe something but a deeper/stronger truth says we do.

If you are the perpetual student then students are allowed to make mistakes, they are given the grace to grow and expand and explore. Something i think "masters" aren't given. And i really love the freedom of the mindset of the eternal student. I can just be and savor and *learn*

Boxes you can check. While u might look like a "master" to someone at the beginning of their path, to someone else you might think yourself the novice to their mastery. And so you can release yourself of the expectation of the "master".

What i love about #magic and the #occult 🧵 is the learning never ends. Because there is never and endpoint or finish, it takes away the pressure to hit that end point and be a certain level of mastery when u get there. "mastery" i think is more about a perspective than a set of

@MatAuryn I heard a perspective i like: we aren't humans here for a spiritual experience but spiritual beings here for a human experience. I think it was @mistahindz that said it. I'm paraphrasing but it's a thought that really changed my practice

@MatAuryn @TarotSkeptic Oh 1000% part of me wants to believe that's just part of the enchantment. Like my headspace approaching a 300$ book with gilded edges and goatskin leather vs a 30$ book from Amazon is just going to be different. Not inherently more valuable but different.
@MatAuryn @TarotSkeptic But ime there is a lot of value to be found in his work. I'm particularly attached to the Azoetia. In conjunction with oneiromancy i found it to be quite powerful

@MatAuryn @TarotSkeptic Where if you read the "right" books, like grant and Crowley it can be decoded. but being too attached to that is another veil imo. It's value is in that fluidity of meaning. It's definitely not for everyone, and i don't think it's so necessary to gatekeep magic.

@MatAuryn @TarotSkeptic I gotta defend Chumbley a bit here. Azoetia in particular. There is a reason for the purple prose. Az is intended to be a living grimoire that is mutable and changes with reading. you can interpret it's mysteries a few ways. For sure there is the scholarly approach 1/

@liminalabyrinth @davidsalisbury @Phantasmaphile So we can tell ourselves we are making a difference while not actually having to make any hard changes to our lifestyle.

@liminalabyrinth @davidsalisbury @Phantasmaphile Huge numbers here, but if we are serious about make a REAL difference, and really conserving our oceans then we need to be honest about the biggest threats. And that's fishing. Changing out straws is vanity conservative. It's an easy change that's makes us feel good 4/

@liminalabyrinth @davidsalisbury @Phantasmaphile Oil spill in the gulf of Mexico, commercial fishing was banned because of the danger of contamination. Over time the fish repopulated healthier because of the break from commercial fishing. Straws account for like .0025% of waste. It's a lot yes, because we are dealing with 3/

@liminalabyrinth @davidsalisbury @Phantasmaphile Mackerel in a day no problem. To get the same amount of mackerel today you have to fish a lot longer. And in doing so you expend more energy AND get a lot more waste catch (i can't remember the specific term). Causing more devastation to the ecosystem. In fact after an oil 2/

@liminalabyrinth @davidsalisbury @Phantasmaphile I was talking about waste produced by the fishing industry because of the demand for fish specifically. Yes, humans have fished for centuries but not to the scale we do today. Not too mention the increased *lack* of fish in general. A hundred years ago you fish out a ton of 1/

@AquariusMage Looove mullein. Found out its called hags taper because part of it can be dried, rolled in wax, and lit as a candle. It's used as medicine for the lungs (though any smoke inhalation has risks, it's a case of poison also being medicine)

@liminalabyrinth @davidsalisbury @Phantasmaphile Eating fish is way more harmful for the environment than straws. Most of the waste in the ocean is fishing equipment. Not to mention the humanitarian issues fishing presents. Check out #seaspiracy

If consequences were as visible as punching someone, if you broke your word you would be hunted, If gods were as petty and vindictive as the old stories- would you be so casual? Would you take the same risks? Would still dabble and experiment? #witchcraft #witchtwt

If #magic was more intense, to the degree that faith wasn't needed because your god could physically reach out and boop u on the nose. A curse made someone's teeth fall out in front of your eyes... Would your practice change? Would you make the same oaths and worship the same?
